That's not what Juncker said. He said that we have deal so we don't need an extension. When asked what if Parliament would reject the deal he said that he isn't in charge of Westminster.
In other words: he rules it out as long as there is a deal. If Parliament rejects it, then there won't be a deal. Then the Benn Act kicks in and the PM has to request for an extension. It's up to Parliament whether there'll be a request for an extension. And only then the EU will consider whether to grant it or not.

I finally get to understand why the negotiations were so difficult. If the UK negotiators can only hear what they want to hear, they will never be able to get what they want to get.
